basics.name: Ivan du Toit
basics.label: Software Development Engineer
basics.summary: Ivan du Toit is an eager learner willing to do any task that delivers the most value to the business, large or small. He has a record of keeping track of complex domains while leading high performance teams at companies like Amazon Web Services

work.position: Amazon Web Services (Software Development Engineer II)
work.summary: I am the team lead for the team that builds the EC2 (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/home) management console. My focus is on increasing operational excellence and increasing our delivery velocity. This includes training new team members and driving the development of a DSL and framework to allow us to delivery more value to out customers, faster.
highlights: Driving and getting projects delivered across teams
Steering and delivering a platform for increase delivery in multiple team
Increased normalized project delivery by 50% YoY for 2 years while the team only grew 10%

work.summary: I worked in the User Experience team to build the EC2 (https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/home) and VPC (console.aws.amazon.com/vpc/home) management consoles. To increase my exposure I am also involved in EC2 API design. Giving back is also important to me by helping newbies in operational excellence 101 training along with mentoring and helping interns
highlights: Reducing my teams operation incidents and load by 20% by driving good operational practice
Training all new on-calls to prepare for their first rotation
Initiating and delivering two big customer asks without impacting the teams roadmap

work.summary: I worked in the User Experience team to build a UI testing framework based on CasperJS and PhantomJS.
highlights: Learned a lot about testing and the impact of good testing on velocity
The framework and design is the bases of the testing used 3 years later

work.summary: I helped students in the COS 151 and COS 110 modules to understand programming practice and complete the course work successfully.
Web applications development and testing including creating a custom content management system. Lead development on the CMS during the last year.

courses: COS121 - Software modelling and design patterns
Introduction to Artificial Intelligence at ai-class.com
